title: Make the Day Details overlay more vertically compact in the full-screen day view

requirements.text: Reduce the vertical space used by the non-editing "Day Details" overlay in the full-screen day view by tightening vertical padding and line-height across all sections (header, rows, and measurements subsection) while keeping existing font sizes unchanged, and ensure the result looks consistently compact on both mobile and desktop.

quotes: The day details block can be a bit more vertically compact

1. All of it
2. Both
3. Just less padding and line height

acceptanceCriteria: In the full-screen day view (frontend/src/components/DayDetailView.tsx), when NOT editing, the Day Details overlay uses noticeably less vertical space than before.
No typography sizes are reduced (e.g., existing text-* size classes remain the same), and the compaction is achieved via reduced padding/margins/gaps and tighter line-height.
The compaction applies to: the overlay container padding, the "Day Details" title spacing, the detail rows spacing, and the Measurements subsection spacing (divider + section label + rows).
The overlay remains readable and does not overlap key controls (date overlay, edit/close buttons) on typical mobile and desktop viewport sizes.

constraints: Do not change font sizes in the Day Details overlay; only adjust padding/spacing and line-height.
Keep changes scoped to the Day Details overlay in the full-screen day view (non-edit mode) and do not modify immutable frontend paths.
nonGoals: Do not change the inline editor layout, form fields, or save behavior.
Do not change backend data models or APIs.
